text: See http://java.net/jira/browse/JAVASERVERFACES-2684. The Tomcat runtime is not cleaning up JAR files when undeploy happens. Note this is a container specific issue since Glassfish does not suffer from this problem.
creator: manfred.riem@oracle.com

text:
This is not a Tomcat bug. Tomcat can't delete a file that is still held open by the application.

In this case the JSF implementation is opening a JAR file and failing to close it. That is a bug in the JSF implementation (as was pointed out in the original JSF bug report that you choose to ignore).
creator: markt@apache.org
